page.title: 05 Shopping.
page.content: There is no proper shop in the village. Sweets and ice creams may be bought at the garage, and odd things are sold at the Post Office. There are a number of mobile shops which visit the village and the milkman carries a wide range of food items. A baker comes to the village three times a week with a good selection of bread and cakes. A butcher with the usual meat products comes on Friday, and a fishmonger visits on Wednesday. A fish and chip van tours the locality at tea-time on Thursday. As all items bought in this way tend to be expensive, most people like to visit a supermarket once a week. The places visited most are Blandford, Poole and Wimborne. For other items such as clothing, furniture and special purchases, Bournemouth and Poole are the favoured places.
